{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Graphics Designer",
  "description": "Mopheth Nigeria Limited is a reputable organization charged with the goal of meeting the diverse needs of its growing customers from all walks of life. We began as a community Pharmacy in the year 1997, and through the years we have maintained our standard of being a renowned name in the pharmaceutical industry in Nigeria, however, with respect to our vision consumables, cosmetics, and skin care products, safe water production, grocery essentials, and a variety of baked goods. In addition, our 24-hour availability onsite and online in all our branches has equally ensured our clients can rely on us for immediate service at any hour of the day.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a versatile and creative professional skilled in WordPress management, graphic design, video editing, infographics creation, and copywriting. The ideal candidate will develop engaging digital content, maintain our website, and ensure brand consistency across all platforms.


Key Responsibilities
WordPress Management:


	Design, update, and maintain company websites using WordPress.
	Optimize site performance, SEO, and security.


Graphic Design:


	Create visually appealing graphics for social media, web, and print.


Video Editing:


	Produce and edit promotional videos, tutorials, and social media clips.


Infographics:


	Design informative and engaging infographics for campaigns and reports.


Copywriting:


	Write compelling website content, blog posts, and marketing copy.
	Collaborate with marketing and content teams to execute creative strategies.
	Ensure all content aligns with brand guidelines and project timelines.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor`s Degree&nbsp;
	2 - 8 years proven of experience in WordPress development and management.
	Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro).
	Strong video editing skills and knowledge of motion graphics.
	Ability to create high-quality infographics.
	Excellent copywriting and content creation skills.
	Knowledge of SEO and digital marketing principles is a plus.


Salary
N150,000 - N300,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrbp@mophethgroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-24",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Mopheth Nigeria Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "190808"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Graphics Designer Job at Mopheth Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Mopheth Nigeria Limited is a reputable organization charged with the goal of meeting the diverse needs of its growing customers from all walks of life. We began as a community Pharmacy in the year 1997, and through the years we have maintained our standard of being a renowned name in the pharmaceutical industry in Nigeria, however, with respect to our vision consumables, cosmetics, and skin care products, safe water production, grocery essentials, and a variety of baked goods. In addition, our 24-hour availability onsite and online in all our branches has equally ensured our clients can rely on us for immediate service at any hour of the day.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a versatile and creative professional skilled in WordPress management, graphic design, video editing, infographics creation, and copywriting. The ideal candidate will develop engaging digital content, maintain our website, and ensure brand consistency across all platforms.


Key Responsibilities
WordPress Management:


	Design, update, and maintain company websites using WordPress.
	Optimize site performance, SEO, and security.


Graphic Design:


	Create visually appealing graphics for social media, web, and print.


Video Editing:


	Produce and edit promotional videos, tutorials, and social media clips.


Infographics:


	Design informative and engaging infographics for campaigns and reports.


Copywriting:


	Write compelling website content, blog posts, and marketing copy.
	Collaborate with marketing and content teams to execute creative strategies.
	Ensure all content aligns with brand guidelines and project timelines.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor`s Degree 
	2 - 8 years proven of experience in WordPress development and management.
	Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro).
	Strong video editing skills and knowledge of motion graphics.
	Ability to create high-quality infographics.
	Excellent copywriting and content creation skills.
	Knowledge of SEO and digital marketing principles is a plus.


Salary
N150,000 - N300,000 monthly. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrbp@mophethgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Customer Success Manager (French Speaking)",
  "description": "At S&amp;P Global Commodity Insights, our complete view of global energy and commodities markets enables our customers to make decisions with conviction and create long-term, sustainable value.&nbsp;We&rsquo;re a trusted connector that brings together thought leaders, market participants, governments, and regulators to co-create solutions that lead to progress. Vital to navigating Energy Transition, S&amp;P Global Commodity Insights&rsquo; coverage includes oil and gas, power, chemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.

S&amp;P Global Commodity Insights is a division of S&amp;P Global (NYSE: SPGI). S&amp;P Global is the world&rsquo;s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks, analytics and workflow solutions in the global capital, commodity and automotive markets. With every one of our offerings, we help many of the world&rsquo;s leading organizations navigate the economic landscape so they can plan for tomorrow, today.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Customer Success Manager (French Speaking)

Job ID:&nbsp;319692
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time
Category:&nbsp;Sales
Grade Level (for internal use): 10

The Team


	You will be part of the EMEA Customer Excellence team at Commodity Insight (CI).
	Part of the wider Customer Experience team at CI, the team focuses on value, trust and delight: ensuring a smooth onboarding, education and enablement of our customers with our solutions.
	Through proactive and reactive customer engagement, the team develops trust and relationships with clients, focusing on their needs and goals.


Responsibilities And Impact


	Engage proactively with customers to understand their needs and ensure they derive maximum value from our solutions.
	Successfully and promptly onboard customers and conduct remote and in-person training sessions to educate customers on our products and services, as well as personalising the sessions based on customer needs and workflows.
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders within customer organizations to drive product adoption and satisfaction.
	Monitor customer usage data to identify opportunities for further engagement and value creation.
	Serve as a trusted advisor, providing insights and recommendations to enhance customer experience and success. Be the voice of the customer to continue improving their experience.
	Cross functional collaboration: Innovate and partner across different functions to create seamless, elevated customer experience.
	Proactive Support: Anticipate customer challenges and address them before they escalate.
	Continual Learning: Stay updated on select industry/market/regional trends and product developments to enrich customer engagements.
	Promptly and accurately capturing customer engagement activities in Salesforce.


Required Qualifications


	Fluency in English and French is required, with a demonstrated ability to communicate effectively in both languages verbally and in writing.
	Ideally 3+ years of experience in customer success, account management, or a similar role.
	This position is not eligible for sponsorship. Candidates must possess the necessary work authorization to be eligible for employment without the need for sponsorship or assistance.
	Bachelor&#39;s degree in business-related discipline is preferred.
	Proficiency in Salesforce or similar CRM is an advantage.
	Industry knowledge (energy, commodities, finance) is an advantage.
	Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
	Proven ability to manage multiple accounts and projects simultaneously.
	Ability to travel to meet clients.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-24",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-25",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "S&P Global Commodity Insights"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"

Customer Success Manager (French Speaking) Job at S&P Global Commodity Insights




        
    

        
        At S&P Global Commodity Insights, our complete view of global energy and commodities markets enables our customers to make decisions with conviction and create long-term, sustainable value. We’re a trusted connector that brings together thought leaders, market participants, governments, and regulators to co-create solutions that lead to progress. Vital to navigating Energy Transition, S&P Global Commodity Insights’ coverage includes oil and gas, power, chemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



S&P Global Commodity Insights is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI). S&P Global is the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks, analytics and workflow solutions in the global capital, commodity and automotive markets. With every one of our offerings, we help many of the world’s leading organizations navigate the economic landscape so they can plan for tomorrow, today.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Success Manager (French Speaking)

Job ID: 319692
Job Location: Abuja, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time
Category: Sales
Grade Level (for internal use): 10

The Team


	You will be part of the EMEA Customer Excellence team at Commodity Insight (CI).
	Part of the wider Customer Experience team at CI, the team focuses on value, trust and delight: ensuring a smooth onboarding, education and enablement of our customers with our solutions.
	Through proactive and reactive customer engagement, the team develops trust and relationships with clients, focusing on their needs and goals.


Responsibilities And Impact


	Engage proactively with customers to understand their needs and ensure they derive maximum value from our solutions.
	Successfully and promptly onboard customers and conduct remote and in-person training sessions to educate customers on our products and services, as well as personalising the sessions based on customer needs and workflows.
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders within customer organizations to drive product adoption and satisfaction.
	Monitor customer usage data to identify opportunities for further engagement and value creation.
	Serve as a trusted advisor, providing insights and recommendations to enhance customer experience and success. Be the voice of the customer to continue improving their experience.
	Cross functional collaboration: Innovate and partner across different functions to create seamless, elevated customer experience.
	Proactive Support: Anticipate customer challenges and address them before they escalate.
	Continual Learning: Stay updated on select industry/market/regional trends and product developments to enrich customer engagements.
	Promptly and accurately capturing customer engagement activities in Salesforce.


Required Qualifications


	Fluency in English and French is required, with a demonstrated ability to communicate effectively in both languages verbally and in writing.
	Ideally 3+ years of experience in customer success, account management, or a similar role.
	This position is not eligible for sponsorship. Candidates must possess the necessary work authorization to be eligible for employment without the need for sponsorship or assistance.
	Bachelor's degree in business-related discipline is preferred.
	Proficiency in Salesforce or similar CRM is an advantage.
	Industry knowledge (energy, commodities, finance) is an advantage.
	Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
	Proven ability to manage multiple accounts and projects simultaneously.
	Ability to travel to meet clients.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Regional Accountant",
  "description": "Genesis is a wholly Nigerian owned group with business interests in hotels, restaurants, cinemas, shopping malls, real estate development, catering and snack foods. Genesis has its corporate head office in Port Harcourt, Rivers State. For twenty five years, we have provided &#39;exceptional products and services&#39; to multinationals, local corporations and the Nigerian public.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Regional Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Ziks Avenue, Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily and weekly sales reconciliations from all restaurants in the region, ensuring POS-to-bank accuracy and immediate investigation of shortages, overages, and timing gaps.
	Review store-level cash handling practices and escalate irregularities or control breakdowns to Operations Leadership.
	Validate proper recording of promotions, discounts, loyalty redemptions, voids, and employee meals to ensure compliance with QSR policy.


Period Close &amp; Financial Reporting:


	Prepare regional period close packages including sales summaries, prime cost variance explanations, labor productivity insights, and controllable cost diagnostics.
	Reconcile inventories for food, packaging, and cleaning supplies; verify alignment with theoretical usage and highlight waste or theft indicators.
	Support corporate accounting with accruals, journal entries, balance sheet reconciliations, prepaid schedules, and fixed asset updates for new openings and remodels.


Cost &amp; Margin Optimization:


	Partner with Area Coaches and Restaurant Managers to understand prime cost drivers&mdash;food cost fluctuations, yield issues, labor allocation&mdash;and provide targeted recommendations.
	Analyze restaurant P&amp;Ls to identify underperforming units and create action plans for cost tightening, throughput improvement, and staffing efficiency.
	Monitor vendor invoice accuracy, contract pricing compliance, and credit/return processing (e.g., product shortages, damaged goods).


Internal Controls &amp; Compliance:


	Conduct periodic restaurant audits covering cash, deposits, petty cash, inventory control, timekeeping accuracy, coupon handling, and operational SOPs.
	Provide guidance during health department audits, royalty reporting, franchise compliance reviews, and internal audit cycles.
	Ensure adherence to corporate purchasing rules, approved supplier lists, and equipment capitalization policies.


Regional Support &amp; Business Partnering:


	Serve as the financial liaison for the Regional Operations Director, translating P&amp;L results into actionable operational insights.
	Train managers and assistant managers on reading P&amp;Ls, understanding food/labor metrics, and using financial dashboards.
	Support new restaurant openings, remodels, and transfers by setting up accounting structures, verifying initial inventories, and ensuring proper financial onboarding.


Required Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s&nbsp;Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	3&ndash;5+ years of accounting experience; at least 2 years in a QSR, restaurant, hospitality, or multi-unit retail environment.
	Strong knowledge of restaurant cost structures, POS systems, and inventory management tools (e.g., Restaurant365, HotSchedules, Toast, NCR, or similar).
	Advanced proficiency in Excel and ability to analyze large datasets quickly.
	Prior involvement in restaurant audits, food cost analysis, or labor modeling.
	Knowledge of franchise finance models, royalty reporting, or brand-mandated accounting systems.
	Operational mindset: Understands how decisions in the kitchen, drive-thru, and front of house impact financial results.
	Problem-solving under pressure: Able to resolve discrepancies quickly in a fast-moving, high-volume environment.
	Excellent communication: Can explain financial concepts to non-financial managers without jargon.
	Ownership and accountability: Treats each restaurant as a mini-business with unique challenges.
	Integrity: Upholds strong ethical and control standards, especially around cash and inventory.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;vacancies@genesisgroupng.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-08",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

Regional Accountant Job at Genesis Cinemas




        
    

        
        Genesis is a wholly Nigerian owned group with business interests in hotels, restaurants, cinemas, shopping malls, real estate development, catering and snack foods. Genesis has its corporate head office in Port Harcourt, Rivers State. For twenty five years, we have provided 'exceptional products and services' to multinationals, local corporations and the Nigerian public.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Regional Accountant

Job Location: Ziks Avenue, Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Oversee daily and weekly sales reconciliations from all restaurants in the region, ensuring POS-to-bank accuracy and immediate investigation of shortages, overages, and timing gaps.
	Review store-level cash handling practices and escalate irregularities or control breakdowns to Operations Leadership.
	Validate proper recording of promotions, discounts, loyalty redemptions, voids, and employee meals to ensure compliance with QSR policy.


Period Close & Financial Reporting:


	Prepare regional period close packages including sales summaries, prime cost variance explanations, labor productivity insights, and controllable cost diagnostics.
	Reconcile inventories for food, packaging, and cleaning supplies; verify alignment with theoretical usage and highlight waste or theft indicators.
	Support corporate accounting with accruals, journal entries, balance sheet reconciliations, prepaid schedules, and fixed asset updates for new openings and remodels.


Cost & Margin Optimization:


	Partner with Area Coaches and Restaurant Managers to understand prime cost drivers—food cost fluctuations, yield issues, labor allocation—and provide targeted recommendations.
	Analyze restaurant P&Ls to identify underperforming units and create action plans for cost tightening, throughput improvement, and staffing efficiency.
	Monitor vendor invoice accuracy, contract pricing compliance, and credit/return processing (e.g., product shortages, damaged goods).


Internal Controls & Compliance:


	Conduct periodic restaurant audits covering cash, deposits, petty cash, inventory control, timekeeping accuracy, coupon handling, and operational SOPs.
	Provide guidance during health department audits, royalty reporting, franchise compliance reviews, and internal audit cycles.
	Ensure adherence to corporate purchasing rules, approved supplier lists, and equipment capitalization policies.


Regional Support & Business Partnering:


	Serve as the financial liaison for the Regional Operations Director, translating P&L results into actionable operational insights.
	Train managers and assistant managers on reading P&Ls, understanding food/labor metrics, and using financial dashboards.
	Support new restaurant openings, remodels, and transfers by setting up accounting structures, verifying initial inventories, and ensuring proper financial onboarding.


Required Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	3–5+ years of accounting experience; at least 2 years in a QSR, restaurant, hospitality, or multi-unit retail environment.
	Strong knowledge of restaurant cost structures, POS systems, and inventory management tools (e.g., Restaurant365, HotSchedules, Toast, NCR, or similar).
	Advanced proficiency in Excel and ability to analyze large datasets quickly.
	Prior involvement in restaurant audits, food cost analysis, or labor modeling.
	Knowledge of franchise finance models, royalty reporting, or brand-mandated accounting systems.
	Operational mindset: Understands how decisions in the kitchen, drive-thru, and front of house impact financial results.
	Problem-solving under pressure: Able to resolve discrepancies quickly in a fast-moving, high-volume environment.
	Excellent communication: Can explain financial concepts to non-financial managers without jargon.
	Ownership and accountability: Treats each restaurant as a mini-business with unique challenges.
	Integrity: Upholds strong ethical and control standards, especially around cash and inventory.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: vacancies@genesisgroupng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Lounge Cashier",
  "description": "Venmac Resources Limited - Our client, The Signature Lounge by Edeka, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Lounge Cashier

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Reports Directly to:&nbsp;The Accountant / Internal Auditor

Responsibilities


	Main function:
	
		Receiving, dispensing and safe guarding cash.
	
	
	Specific Duties &amp; Activities
	
		Areas of&nbsp;Responsibility
		
			As part of the front-end operations team, the Cashier is responsible for maintaining outstanding guest service as per hotel standards, processing sales quickly, accurately and efficiently.
		
		
		Specific Duties and Activities
		
			Count money in cash drawers at the beginning of shifts to ensure that amounts are correct and that there is adequate change.
			Establish or identify prices of goods, services and tabulate bills using calculators and cash registers.
			Assisting with guest calls, inquiries and disputes.
			Attend all departmental meetings, briefings &amp; internal or external training sessions as required.
			The restaurant cashier&rsquo;s job description covers interacting with customers and accepting payment from them for products and services provided.
			Act wholeheartedly in the interests of the Company at all times &amp; not to perform, arrange or carry out any work or activity which could be considered to be in competition with or affect in any way the company interests or be detrimental or damaging to its public image.
			Receive payments and present change to customers.
			Cash handling.
			Balancing account at the end of every shift or sells.
			Communicate guest requests to management.
			Any other tasks as assigned from time to time by any manager.
			Good working knowledge of eZee hospitality solutions.
			Any other assigned duty by the management.
		
		
	
	


Salary
N30,000 - N50,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;venmachospitality@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-24",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-22",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Venmac Resources Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

}



Lounge Cashier Job at Venmac Resources Limited




        
    

        
        Venmac Resources Limited - Our client, The Signature Lounge by Edeka, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Lounge Cashier

Job Location: Abuja
Reports Directly to: The Accountant / Internal Auditor

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Main function:
	
		Receiving, dispensing and safe guarding cash.
	
	
	Specific Duties & Activities
	
		Areas of Responsibility
		
			As part of the front-end operations team, the Cashier is responsible for maintaining outstanding guest service as per hotel standards, processing sales quickly, accurately and efficiently.
		
		
		Specific Duties and Activities
		
			Count money in cash drawers at the beginning of shifts to ensure that amounts are correct and that there is adequate change.
			Establish or identify prices of goods, services and tabulate bills using calculators and cash registers.
			Assisting with guest calls, inquiries and disputes.
			Attend all departmental meetings, briefings & internal or external training sessions as required.
			The restaurant cashier’s job description covers interacting with customers and accepting payment from them for products and services provided.
			Act wholeheartedly in the interests of the Company at all times & not to perform, arrange or carry out any work or activity which could be considered to be in competition with or affect in any way the company interests or be detrimental or damaging to its public image.
			Receive payments and present change to customers.
			Cash handling.
			Balancing account at the end of every shift or sells.
			Communicate guest requests to management.
			Any other tasks as assigned from time to time by any manager.
			Good working knowledge of eZee hospitality solutions.
			Any other assigned duty by the management.
		
		
	
	


Salary
N30,000 - N50,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: venmachospitality@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accounts Officer",
  "description": "Sterling Health HMO is a National Health Insurance Agency (NHIA)-accredited Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) that has been providing 24/7/365 quality affordable healthcare service to the public and private sector nationally since 2007.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Degree in Accounting&nbsp;
	Experience in a similar setting is an advantage&nbsp;
	Ready to start immediately.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to:&nbsp;sterlinghmo@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-24",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
